text: Western Development Region ( - Pashchimānchal Bikās Kshetra) was one of Nepal's five development regions. It was in the west-central part of the country. Its headquarters were at Pokhara. ==Geography== The Western Development Region had the Central Development Region to the east, the India to the south, the Mid-Western Development Region to the west and the People's Republic of China to the north. The region was the second largest Development Region of Nepal. Its area was . It was the third in population with 4,926,765 people living there in 2011. Its population density is of 167.6 persons/km2. Some of the highest mountains of the world were found in this region, in the Himalayas of the Dhawalagiri and Gandaki zones. Among them are Dhaulagiri (), Manaslu () and Annapurna (). The most important river in the Western Development Region is the Gandaki, left tributary of the Ganges river. ==Cities== Some cities of this region were Pokhara, Baglung, Butwall, Sandhikharka, Tansen, Tilaurakot, etc. ==Administrative subdivisions== The region had 3 zones with a total of 16 districts: Zone Population (2011) Area (km²) Pop. density (inh/km²) Districts Number Names Dhawalagiri 542,296 8,148 66.6 4 Baglung, Mustang, Myagdi, Parbat Gandaki 1,549,857 12,275 126.3 6 Gorkha, Kaski, Lamjung, Manang, Syangja, Tanahu Lumbini 2,834,612 8,975 315.8 6 Arghakhanchi, Gulmi, Kapilvastu, Nawalparasi, Palpa,Rupandehi Total 9,656,985 27,410 352.3 16 ==Related pages== *Development Regions of Nepal *Districts of Nepal *Zones of Nepal ==References== ==Other websites== * Administrative Division of Nepal - Geonames * Paścimāñcala Category:Subdivisions of Nepal
title: Western Development Region, Nepal
